Standards#

Here, standard functions throughout the library are defined. These are typically functions which are used regularly.

Contains several standard functions and the class string

Author

Mike Moser

namespace mml

Functions

template<typename templ>
double atob(const templ &t) noexcept#

Converts value to bool.

Parameters:

t – Value

Returns:

bool

template<typename T>
double atof(const T &t) noexcept#

Converts value to bool.

Parameters:

t – Value

Returns:

double

template<typename T>
int atoi(const T &t) noexcept#

Converts value to int.

Parameters:

t – Value

Returns:

int

bool check_root(std::string programme = "", mml::string logpath = "")#

Check if program executed as root.

Parameters:

  • programme – Programme name

  • logpath – Path to the logfile, by default “” which means it is not used

Throws:

runtime_error – : if user is not root

Returns:

true if root

Returns:

false if not root

template<typename templ>
void cout(std::vector<templ> const &vec) noexcept#

Prints the values of a vector

Parameters:

vec – Vector to be printed

uint32_t date(int info, time_t time1 = -1) noexcept#

Returns the wished info from the time (like date etc.) Options are:

  • 0: Seconds

  • 1: Minutes

  • 2: Hours

  • 3: Day

  • 4: Month

  • 5: Year

  • 6: Summertime

  • 7: Weekday (Days since sunday)

  • 8: Yearday (Days since New Year)

  • 9: kw

Author

Mike

Parameters:

  • info – Determines what information is printed

  • time1 – Time for which the information is printed. -1 => Actual time now.

Returns:

unsigned integer

std::string date(time_t time1 = -1, mml::string value = "Date+Time", std::string separator1 = ":", std::string separator2 = ".") noexcept#

Returns the date and/or time as a std::string.

Author

Mike

Parameters:

  • time1 – Time for which the information is printed. -1 => Actual time now

  • value – Determines what information is printed.

    • ”Date” : DD.MM.YYYY (based on separator1)

    • ”Time” : HH:MM:SS (based on separator1)

    • ”Date+Time” : Complete date in format DD.MM.YYYY HH:MM:SS.

    • ”Date1+Time” : Compete date in format YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS.

  • separator1 – First separation sign for the date

  • separator2 – Second separation sign for the time

Returns:

std::string

bool isnum(char c) noexcept#

Checks if a character is a number.

Parameters:

c – Character to be checked

Returns:

bool

bool range(std::size_t number) noexcept#

Checks if a number has reached the maximum value (std::string::npos)

Parameters:

number – Number to be checked

Returns:

true : smaller than the maximum value

bool range(std::size_t number1, std::size_t number2) noexcept#

Checks if one of two numbers has reached the maximum value.

Parameters:

  • number1 – Number to be checked

  • number2 – Number to be checked

Returns:

true : at least one number is smaller than the max. value

double round(double number, uint16_t digits) noexcept#

round a number

Parameters:

  • number – Number which is rounded

  • digits – To which digit it is rounded

Returns:

round number

template<typename T>
mml::string to_string(const T &t) noexcept#

Convert value to mml::string.

Parameters:

t – Value to be changed

Returns:

mml::string

constexpr uint32_t const_string_hash(const char *string) noexcept#

Forms a hash value of a string.

Parameters:

string – String to be converted

Returns:

Hash value

std::string declare_month(int month_nr) noexcept#

Convert month number to month string.

Parameters:

month_nr – Month as a number

Returns:

Name of the month as a string

template<typename templ>
void erase(std::vector<templ> &data) noexcept#

Empty a vector.

Parameters:

data – Reference to the vector to be erased

template<typename templ>
templ get_random(templ min = 0, templ max = 100) noexcept#

Create a random number in a defined range.

Parameters:

  • min – Lowest Number

  • max – Highes Number

Returns:

generated random number

template<typename templ>
templ smallest_num(std::vector<templ> values, std::size_t pos = 0)#

Return the smallest number.

Parameters:

  • values – Values as a vector

  • pos – Start position

Throws:

logic_error – : if type is non-arithmetic

Returns:

smallest number

std::string random_str(size_t letters = 10, std::string start = "") noexcept#

Create a random, lower-case string.

Parameters:

  • letters – Number of letters

  • start – Add the generated characters to this string

Returns:

generated string

std::size_t digits(double number) noexcept#

Determine number of digits of a double number.

Parameters:

number – the number

Returns:

Number of digits
